title: duplicated row inserted after I batch insert data into a distributed table
body:
I got duplicated data after I batch insert data into a distributed table.

ClickHouse server version 20.4.4.18 (official build).
I have setup 3 nodes cluster.
the product-cluster is defined as following:
```
<prd_cluster>
    <shard>
        <internal_replication>true</internal_replication>
        <replica>
            <default_database>s1</default_database>
            <host>map01</host>
            <port>9000</port>
        </replica>
        <replica>
            <default_database>s1</default_database>
            <host>lop05</host>
            <port>9000</port>
        </replica>
    </shard>
    <shard>
        <internal_replication>true</internal_replication>
        <replica>
            <default_database>s2</default_database>
            <host>map02</host>
            <port>9000</port>
        </replica>
        <replica>
            <default_database>s2</default_database>
            <host>map01</host>
            <port>9000</port>
        </replica>
    </shard>
    <shard>
        <internal_replication>true</internal_replication>
        <replica>
            <default_database>s3</default_database>
            <host>lop05</host>
            <port>9000</port>
        </replica>
        <replica>
            <default_database>s3</default_database>
            <host>map02</host>
            <port>9000</port>
        </replica>
    </shard>
</prd_cluster>
```
the cluster has 3 shards, each shard has 2 replica, to provide HA.
i have setup zookeeper for replica, still using these 3 nodes.
```
<zookeeper>
    <node index="1">
        <host>map01</host>
        <port>2181</port>
    </node>
    <node index="2">
        <host>map02</host>
        <port>2181</port>
    </node>
    <node index="3">
        <host>lop05</host>
        <port>2181</port>
    </node>
</zookeeper>
```
my data insertion logic is following:
i will do a query to the target db(clickhouse) to check what is the last timestamp inserted, then i will generated a new query from source table(mysql) to get new time-windowed data, then batch insert to clickhouse.

in order to reach atomic insertion, the data i inserted is less than 1,000,000bytes, and belongs to the same partition. (same shop_id).
following is the sample schema i used.
```
CREATE TABLE if not exists s1.work_order
(
    `id` Int64,
    `gmt_created` DateTime,
    `gmt_modified` DateTime,
    `created_by` String,
    `modified_by` String,
    `is_deleted` Int8,
    `comment` Nullable(String),
    `attributes` Nullable(String),
    `merchant_id` Int64,
    `shop_id` Int64,
)
Engine=ReplicatedMergeTree('/clickhouse/tables/{shard1}/work_order', '01')
PARTITION BY shop_id
ORDER BY id;

CREATE TABLE if not exists s2.work_order as s1.work_order
Engine=ReplicatedMergeTree('/clickhouse/tables/{shard2}/work_order', '02')
PARTITION BY shop_id
ORDER BY id;

CREATE TABLE if not exists work_order as s1.work_order ENGINE = Distributed('prd_cluster', '', work_order, rand());
```
i do insertion via command line interface, insert to node map02's distributed table.
```
cat file.csv | clickhouse-client --host map02 --database=default --query="INSERT INTO work_order FORMAT TSV";
```
i found lots of duplicated data doing this way. 1%
then i chatted on slack, expert suggested to try to insert to local table to see whether this goes away.
i tried, and this problem goes away.
but i have to use the sharded feature, so  i have to insert into distributed table.
then i add logic to wait till the previous insert succeeded (to avoid non-atomic behavior), i wait till the intended inserted rows (i do a query for that) >= the rows i inserted, if less then i need to wait more, if equals, that is great, if more, that means duplicated occurs, and i recorded all the duplicates.
by doing this, the duplicated data drops, but still like 0.001% duplicates.

any suggestions?

The workaround i am using now is, first when i do a next batch insert, i will check the previous batch insert by query, making sure the number of records in the target equals to what i inserted, wait if less than, if more than then there is an internal error, i will record the query and the data file I used in this batch insert, then I will do a delete using that query, and redo a batch insert using the saved data file.

title: Add support for setting query_id in SETTING block

labels.name: st-discussion
labels.description: The story requires discussion /research / expert help / design & decomposition before will be taken

body:
**Use case**
Query_id is used for troubleshooting of applications when analyzing query logs. Currently the only method is to use it are:
- HTTP interface - if driver does not support it - rely on multiline comment
- clickhouse-client - only supplying query id in non-interactive mode. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
allow specifying SETTINGS query_id='dqdwqdq'

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Putting query id in part of actual query as one of the fields or constant conditions, or in WITH clause.

title: Avro Schema Evolution Support

labels.name: comp-formats
labels.description: Input / output formats

body:
I use AvroConfulent data format with schema registry to consume Kafka events to clickhouse.
* сurrently, Avro schemas are cached once resolved 
* after evolving Avro schema(add fields) clickhouse doesn't fetch new schema and failed with an error on SELECT raws from Kafka table
* recreate Kafka table, change format_avro_schema_registry_url and restart clickhouse server doesn't refresh the cache
* if I create the same Table on another Kafka topic with the same format everything works correctly, and I guess that schema cache works by schema name

As I understand these lines of code and comments in PR, fetch a new Avro schema should work automatically:
https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/pull/8953/files/927e572d39432d22ae96e087674a5124c6e2931b#diff-4c0061c616a674630b9e2e74706e6255R61
https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/pull/8571
> AvroConfluent only caches schemas per an instance of an InputFormat. This means SchemaRegistry will be queried each time a batch from Kafka is processed.

title: Comparison of nullables inside tuples

labels.name: comp-nullable
labels.description: Nulls related

body:
**Describe the bug**
Comparing nullable against non-nullable works fine:
```
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select 'b' > 'a'"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select toNullable('b') > 'a'"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select toNullable('b') > toNullable('a')"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select 'b' > toNullable('a')"
1
```

But when we put nullable inside single element tuple, it crashes the server (after each crash I restarted the server):
```
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple('b') > tuple('a')"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple(toNullable('b')) > tuple('a')"
curl: (52) Empty reply from server
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple(toNullable('b')) > tuple(toNullable('a'))"
curl: (52) Empty reply from server
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple('b') > tuple(toNullable('a'))"
curl: (52) Empty reply from server
```
Server stderr looks like the following:
```
2020.06.26 18:57:07.770739 [ 20123 ] {} <Trace> HTTPHandler-factory: HTTP Request for HTTPHandler-factory. Method: POST, Address: [::1]:38144, User-Agent: curl/7.58.0, Length: 42, Content Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded, Transfer Encoding: identity                                                              
2020.06.26 18:57:07.771115 [ 20123 ] {} <Trace> DynamicQueryHandler: Request URI: /                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
2020.06.26 18:57:07.771927 [ 20123 ] {6015c322-8e28-49e9-a8b5-126e7c4d2244} <Debug> executeQuery: (from [::1]:38144) select tuple(toNullable('b')) > tuple('a')                                                                                                                                                               
2020.06.26 18:57:07.773392 [ 20123 ] {6015c322-8e28-49e9-a8b5-126e7c4d2244} <Trace> ContextAccess (default): Access granted: SELECT(dummy) ON system.one                                                                                                                                                                      
2020.06.26 18:57:07.773629 [ 20123 ] {6015c322-8e28-49e9-a8b5-126e7c4d2244} <Trace> InterpreterSelectQuery: FetchColumns -> Complete                                                                                                                                                                                          
2020.06.26 18:57:07.774329 [ 20123 ] {6015c322-8e28-49e9-a8b5-126e7c4d2244} <Error> : Logical error: 'Bad cast from type DB::ColumnNullable to DB::ColumnVector<unsigned char>'.                                                                                                                                              
clickhouse-server: /place/db-0/key_0/srvs/worker_3e27dc966f8b8c61e8432d508e3db20f/srvdata/tared_svnc/12f2797-39a58e0c-86c4981b-2a8660d6/clickhouse/src/Common/Exception.cpp:45: DB::Exception::Exception(const std::string &, int): Assertion `false' failed.                                                                 
2020.06.26 18:57:07.774630 [ 20054 ] {} <Trace> BaseDaemon: Received signal 6                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
2020.06.26 18:57:07.774978 [ 20303 ] {} <Fatal> BaseDaemon: ########################################                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
```

What surprises me, longer tuples work just fine:
```
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple(toNullable('b'), toNullable('b')) > tuple('a', 'a')"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple(toNullable('b'), 'b') > tuple('a', 'a')"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple('b', toNullable('b')) > tuple('a', 'a')"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple('b', toNullable('b')) > tuple(toNullable('a'), 'a')"
1
$ curl localhost:8123 -d "select tuple('b', toNullable('b')) > tuple(toNullable('a'), toNullable('a'))"
1
```

**How to reproduce**
* Which ClickHouse server version to use
```
$ ./clickhouse-server -V
ClickHouse server version 20.6.1.1-arcadia.
```

title: allow_ddl option is not consistent over restarts
body:
**version**
reproduced on 19.17.4.11 and latest 20.1.15.109
 
**Describe the bug**
My goal is to disable DDL operations for default profile.

I've created new profile with `allow_ddl: 1` and set `allow_ddl` to 0 for default profile.

clickhouse-server reloads config on the fly and now you can execute DDL with new profile. With default profile DDL queries fail as expected.

After restarting the clickhouse-server you can't execute DDL queries either by default profile or by new profile.

**How to reproduce**
simple demo
```
git clone https://gist.github.com/e95f89230004f3a6107f35f1a5bf8b56.git
bash run.sh
```

labels.description: Issue affects version 19.14.* or PR was manually backported to related stable branch

body:
Clickhouse server is crashing randomly (once every dozen times) when running a query that groups by LowCardinality column against a buffer table through a distributed table.

Version:
```19.14.10.16 (official build)```

Query:
```
select max(start) 
  from test.logs
group by client_id
```
Tables:
```
CREATE TABLE test.logs_buffer (
`ingest_time` DateTime DEFAULT now(), 
`start` DateTime, 
`client_id` LowCardinality(String), 
`metric_value` UInt64) ENGINE = Buffer(test, logs_local, 16, 3, 20, 2000000, 20000000, 100000000, 300000000)

CREATE TABLE test.logs_local (
`ingest_time` DateTime DEFAULT now(), 
`start` DateTime, 
`client_id` LowCardinality(String), 
`metric_value` UInt64) ENGINE = MergeTree PARTITION BY formatDateTime(start, '%Y%m%d%H') ORDER BY (start) TTL start + toIntervalHour(1) SETTINGS index_granularity = 8192


CREATE TABLE test.logs (
`ingest_time` DateTime, 
`start` DateTime, `service` 
`client_id` LowCardinality(String), 
`metric_value` UInt64) ENGINE = Distributed(shards, 'test', logs_buffer, rand())
```

`client_id` characteristic:
451 unique alphanumeric strings with max length of 10

Insertion rate:
36k / sec (6k / sec per node)

title: View of MV slower than querying directly?

labels.name: v20.3-affected
labels.description: This issue affects some releases of v20.3

labels.name: v20.4-affected
labels.description: This issue affects some releases of v20.4

body:
```sql

CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW player_champ_counts_mv
ENGINE = AggregatingMergeTree() ORDER BY (patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id)
as select patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id, countState() as c_state
from full_info
group by patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id;

create view player_champ_counts as
select patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id, countMerge(c_state) as c
from player_champ_counts_mv
group by patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id;
```

2.4s:
`select * from player_champ_counts`

900ms:
```
select patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id, countMerge(c_state) as c
from player_champ_counts_mv
group by patch_num, my_account_id, champ_id;
```

In other words, just inlining the definition of the view is doing something different than querying the view itself.

title: Atomic inserts (on parts level) to main table and all dependant Materialized views
body:
Insert into table and all materialized view should be atomic (i.e. single failed MV = data not inserted nor to source table, nor to any Materialized view, proper exception passed).

That is in roadmap already [p. 24.23](https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/blob/master/docs/ru/whats-new/extended-roadmap.md#2423-%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F-%D0%BF%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%B4%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B6%D0%BA%D0%B0-%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B7%D0%B0%D0%BA%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B9-%D0%B4%D0%BB%D1%8F-%D0%BC%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B6%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%B0-%D0%B2%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%BE%D0%BA%D1%87%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B9-minimalnaia-podderzhka-tranzaktsii-dlia-mnozhestva-vstavokchtenii)

Sometimes `drop table foo` would return error `Table was not dropped because ZooKeeper session has expired` and this could continue forever without auto recovery.
I have to `detach` the table and `attach` again to be able to `drop` it. 
Is this the expected behavior? 

**How to reproduce**
* Which ClickHouse server version to use
20.3.7

* Queries to run that lead to unexpected result
drop table foo

**Expected behavior**
ClickHouse server should try to fix the expired ZK session so that retries of `drop table` could go through without manual `detach` + `attach`

title: Long running Distributed DDL fail with `Cannot execute replicated DDL query on leader`

labels.name: comp-dddl
labels.description: Distributed DDL feature

body:
Hello,

I'm running into the following issue with some Distributed DDL queries, ie ALTER MODIFY COLUMN which are long running due to the need of rewriting data. They fail with `Cannot execute replicated DDL query on leader` error, but they don't have to.

The issues is here: https://github.com/ClickHouse/Clickhouse/blob/42b8ed3ec64d7077422afb898db174edf6c191b0/src/Interpreters/DDLWorker.cpp#L776 replicas wait only 20 seconds (20 tries with 1 second sleep after each) when checking the status of the migration, since those migrations are taking longer than that it fails with the above mentioned error.

Maybe we should wait as long as the execution lock is held by the a leader instead?

Example query:

```sql
ALTER TABLE test
    ON CLUSTER 'test'
    MODIFY COLUMN float_as_uint UInt16;
```

Note: I'm testing this on v19 but I believe current master is affected as well.

Changelog category (leave one):
- New Feature


Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Initial implementation of `EXPLAIN` query. Syntax: `EXPLAIN SELECT ...`. This fixes #1118.

Usage: 
```sql
EXPLAIN [AST | SYNTAX | PLAN | PIPELINE] [setting = value, ...] SELECT ... [FORMAT ...]
```

#### `EXPLAIN AST`
Dump query AST.
```sql
EXPLAIN AST SELECT 1

SelectWithUnionQuery (children 1)
 ExpressionList (children 1)
  SelectQuery (children 1)
   ExpressionList (children 1)
    Literal UInt64_1
```

#### `EXPLAIN SYNTAX`
Return query after syntax optimisations.
```sql
EXPLAIN SYNTAX SELECT * FROM system.numbers AS a, system.numbers AS b, system.numbers AS c

SELECT 
    `--a.number` AS `a.number`,
    `--b.number` AS `b.number`,
    number AS `c.number`
FROM 
(
    SELECT 
        number AS `--a.number`,
        b.number AS `--b.number`
    FROM system.numbers AS a
    CROSS JOIN system.numbers AS b
) AS `--.s`
CROSS JOIN system.numbers AS c
```

#### `EXPLAIN PLAN`
Dump query plan steps.
```sql
EXPLAIN SELECT sum(number) FROM numbers(10) GROUP BY number % 4

Union
  Expression (Projection)
    Expression (Before ORDER BY and SELECT)
      Aggregating
        Expression (Before GROUP BY)
          ReadFromStorage (Read from SystemNumbers)
```
Settings:
* `header` - print output header for step. Default: 0.
* `description` - print step description. Default: 1.
* `actions` - print detailed information about step actions. Default: 0.

#### `EXPLAIN PIPELINE`
```sql
EXPLAIN PIPELINE SELECT sum(number) FROM numbers_mt(100000) GROUP BY number % 4

(Union)
Converting
  (Expression)
  ExpressionTransform
    (Expression)
    ExpressionTransform
      (Aggregating)
      Resize 32 -> 1
        AggregatingTransform x 32
          (Expression)
          ExpressionTransform x 32
            (ReadFromStorage)
            NumbersMt x 32 0 -> 1
```

Settings:
* `header` - print header for each output port. Default: 0.
* `graph` - use DOT graph description language. Default: 0.
* `compact` - print graph in compact mode if `graph` is enabled. Default: 1.

title: ROLLUP and HAVING together (totals_mode = 'after_having_auto')
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to make a query which will return lines with sums, less then some value, in a rollup view.

For instance, for this query:
``` sql
-- totals_mode = 'after_having_auto'
select a, sum(b)
from
(
select 1 a, -100 b
union all
select 2, -200
union all
select 2, -300
union all
select 3, 300
) t
group by a with rollup
having sum(b) < 100
order by a
```

I expect to have:

``` sql
a   sum(b)
------------
0  -600
1  -100
2  -500
```

But I get:

``` sql
a   sum(b)
------------
0  -300
1  -100
2  -500
```

So HAVING is applied after ROLLUP even if I use `totals_mode = 'after_having_auto'` parameter.

Is this correct behavior or did I miss something?
CH version is 19.14.11.16.

Thanks.

title: Allow to initialize aggregate function state with given arguments
body:
i.e., now I can write:
```
select state from (select minState(x) from (select 1 x));
```
This doesn't work when there are other columns, I have to put them under group by which is cumbersome and wasteful.

I want to be able to write:
```
select a, initializeAggregation('minState', b) from (select 1 a, 2 b);
```
The name is by analogy with `finalizeAggregation`, but not sure it's the best.

Currently it can be emulated with arrayReduce, which is not obvious and inefficient:
```
select a, arrayReduce('minState', [b]) from (select 1 a, 2 b);
```

Having a proper feature for this would simplify working with aggregate function states as normal values, like we do for e.g. bitmaps.

title: ARRAY JOIN with LIMIT BY incorrectly estimates required memory
body:
**Describe the bug**
It seems a combination of `ARRAY JOIN` with `LIMIT BY` in the same select query makes memory estimate wrong

**How to reproduce**
* Which ClickHouse server version to use
 20.4.5 revision 54434.

* Which interface to use, if matters
Doesn't matter, tested through CLI client.

* Queries to run that lead to unexpected result
```sql
SELECT
    a,
    b,
    c
FROM
(
    SELECT
        a,
        groupArray(b) AS b_,
        max(b) AS max_b,
        groupArray(c) AS c
    FROM
    (
        SELECT *
        FROM generateRandom('a Int8, b Int8, c UInt64')
        LIMIT 10000000
    )
    GROUP BY a
)
ARRAY JOIN
    b_ AS b,
    c
WHERE b = max_b
LIMIT 1 BY a
```

**Expected behavior**
Not more than 256 rows of output.

**Error message and/or stacktrace**
```
↘ Progress: 10.03 million rows, 100.27 MB (11.93 million rows/s., 119.31 MB/s.)
Received exception from server (version 20.4.5):
Code: 241. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Memory limit (for query) exceeded: would use 512.32 GiB (attempt to allocate chunk of 549755813456 bytes), maximum: 9.31 GiB.

0 rows in set. Elapsed: 1.141 sec. Processed 10.03 million rows, 100.27 MB (8.79 million rows/s., 87.86 MB/s.)
```

**Workaround**

Wrap `ARRAY JOIN` into subquery and do `LIMIT BY` on top of it:
```sql
SELECT *
FROM
(
    SELECT
        a,
        b,
        c
    FROM
    (
        -- same thing as above
    )
    ARRAY JOIN
        b_ AS b,
        c
    WHERE b = max_b
)
LIMIT 1 BY a
```

labels.name: doc-alert

labels.name: pr-feature
labels.description: Pull request with new product feature

body:
I hereby agree to the terms of the CLA available at: https://yandex.ru/legal/cla/?lang=en

Changelog category (leave one):
- New Feature

Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
New functions aes_encrypt, aes_encrypt_mysql, aes_decrypt, aes_decrypt_mysql. 
...


Detailed description / Documentation draft:
New encryption/decryption functions

## aes_encrypt(plaintext, key, mode, [iv, aad])
## aes_encrypt_mysql(plaintext, key, mode, [iv, aad])
## aes_decrypt(ciphertext, key, mode, [iv, aad])
## aes_decrypt_mysql(ciphertext, key, mode, [iv, aad]). 
Support encrypting/decrypting in following modes:

* aes-128-ecb
* aes-192-ecb
* aes-256-ecb
* aes-128-cbc
* aes-192-cbc
* aes-256-cbc
* aes-128-cfb1
* aes-192-cfb1
* aes-256-cfb1
* aes-128-cfb8
* aes-192-cfb8
* aes-256-cfb8
* aes-128-cfb128
* aes-192-cfb128
* aes-256-cfb128
* aes-128-ofb
* aes-192-ofb
* aes-256-ofb
* aes-128-gcm
* aes-192-gcm
* aes-256-gcm

functions with `_mysql` are to provide compatibility with MySQL when encrypting/decrypting data. That is: do not check `iv` length, and also "fold" keys that are longer than required by the cipher.
For '-gcm' modes, an `AEAD` tag is appended to the resulting ciphertext according to the RFC5116 on encryption and is expected to be present there on decryption.
AAD-parameter is taken into account only for '-gcm' modes.
IV is required for '-gcm' modes, and can be optional for other modes.
...

```python
import numpy as np

engine = create_engine(uri)
metadata = MetaData()

sql = """
SELECT toYYYYMMDD(trade_datetime) AS trade_dt, s_info_windcode, SUM(volume) AS volume FROM minute_bar
WHERE toInt64(toYYYYMMDDhhmmss(trade_datetime)) - toInt64(toYYYYMMDD(trade_datetime)) * 1000000 > 94500
AND toInt64(toYYYYMMDDhhmmss(trade_datetime)) - toInt64(toYYYYMMDD(trade_datetime)) * 1000000 < 141500
GROUP BY toYYYYMMDD(trade_datetime), s_info_windcode"""
```

Segmentation Fault when using join_algorithm='partial_merge'

labels.name: crash
labels.description: Crash / segfault / segmentation

labels.name: v20.3-affected
labels.description: This issue affects some releases of v20.3

body:
**Describe the bug**
Segmentation fault when using join_algorithm='partial_merge'

**How to reproduce**
Trying to merge large tables using merge join. 
Problem does NOT happen when limits are applied on the "right" table. 
Could not understand specific threshold on when it start to appear. 
Right table is heavy and has long strings of 50-400 char wide. 
Version: 20.3.11.97

```
(select from fact group by) -- uses two-stage grouping due to memory peakmem 2GB 
join 
(select from bigdimension) — ~67 mln + fat strings, peakmem 6GB
```

UPD:
Problem is happening when using LowCardinality on the right side table. 
Query to reproduce (although depending on conditions it may fail with failure to allocate memory):
```
select 
attr.k1,
attr.dim1,
fact.k1,
fact.gk1val,
fact.gk2val,
fact.gk3val from
(
select k1, k2,
(groupArrayInsertAt(Null, 3)(tuple(toNullable(val)), toUInt32(indexOf(range(3), gk) - 1)).1 as arr)[1] gk1val,
arr[2] gk2val,arr[3] gk3val
from (
select cityHash64(number) as k1, toString(cityHash64(number,2)) as k2, toString(cityHash64(number,gk)) as val, gk from numbers(1000000)
array join range(3) as gk
) group by k1, k2 
) as fact
JOIN 
(
	select cityHash64(number) as k1, toLowCardinality(arrayStringConcat(arrayMap(x-> toString(x),range(cityHash64(number)%100)),'-')) dim1 from numbers(10000000)
)
as attr using k1
SETTINGS max_bytes_before_external_group_by='500M',join_algorithm='partial_merge'
Format Null;
```
Same query works correctly without having "toLowCardinality" (but too slow), and does not utilize much memory. 

**Expected behavior**
clickhouse query shall not result in segmentation faults and query shall be completed successfully. 

**Error message and/or stacktrace**
```
2020.06.19 15:13:30.829653 [ 14927 ] {} <Fatal> BaseDaemon: (version 20.3.11.97 (official build)) (from thread 14872) (query_id: 864f09d2-8cc0-44df-8a44-72fc974269e8) Received signal Segmentation fault (11).
2020.06.19 15:13:30.829695 [ 14927 ] {} <Fatal> BaseDaemon: Address: 0x1 Access: read. Address not mapped to object.

2020.06.19 15:13:30.879340 [ 14927 ] {} <Fatal> BaseDaemon: 3. DB::ColumnString::insertFrom(DB::IColumn const&, unsigned long) @ 0xd5c7718 in /usr/bin/clickhouse
2020.06.19 15:13:30.879432 [ 14927 ] {} <Fatal> BaseDaemon: 4. ? @ 0xd445dbe in /usr/bin/clickhouse
```

title: Add ability to set custom programname for syslog logger
body:
For now syslog logs doesn't contain correct programname:
```2020.06.19 12:01:18.361028 [ 24759 ] {} <Debug> DiskLocal: Reserving 1.26 MiB on disk `default`, having unreserved 103.22 GiB.```

User can set only custom: `hostname` or `facility`
I suggest to add option for setting custom syslog programname (TAG field without process id):
```
<logger>
    <use_syslog>1</use_syslog>
    <syslog>
      <programname>clickhouse-production-scc</programname>
    </syslog>
</logger>
```

RFC 5424                  The Syslog Protocol  
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424
> The MSG part of the message is described as TAG and CONTENT in RFC
>    3164.  In this document, MSG is what was called CONTENT in RFC 3164.
>    The TAG is now part of the header, but not as a single field.  The
>    TAG has been split into APP-NAME, PROCID, and MSGID.  This does not
>    totally resemble the usage of TAG, but provides the same
>    functionality for most of the cases

title: How to share data among readonly replicas/computation nodes
body:
In order to handle the expected high load during some peak period like Black-Friday in retailing, we may  
 need to prepare more machines and launch more replicas, this means preparing more data copies ahead.
With distributed file system storage, I wonder is there any way to not copy even more data, but to share them among the new launched nodes? These nodes can be read-only or computation-only.

title: Clean znodes while DROP PARTITION or TRUNCATE table by providing settings or clause

labels.name: comp-zookeeper
labels.description: Zookeeper

body:
**Use case**
Most of our reports partitioned by day, and every day we need to replace 1-30 (may be even more) previous days of data per table from new calculated sources. In order to minimize etl interruption, we use a temporary table to do this, truncate, insert, and then replace partitions with the product table. Using this pattern, we saw truncates slow down every day ( also, the znodes growing is worrying) .

In current design, drop partition doesn't remove partition znodes in block_numbers for some racing consideration. #3322 #6267 But as a user, we do know, with our current usage pattern, insert/drop racing cannot happen. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Please consider to provide the ability to **let user control whether the DROP/truncate can safely delete zk partition nodes** as well.


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Add setting like `enable_drop_partition_clean_znodes`. With this settings enabled, DROP PARTITION/TRUNCATE will delete related partition within block_numbers... or
Add clause like `TRUNCATE TABLE .... [FINAL]` ...

title: Input formats: save unknown fields to a special column instead of skipping

labels.name: comp-formats
labels.description: Input / output formats

body:
**Use case**
If `input_format_skip_unknown_fields = 1` (skipping is enabled), ClickHouse doesn’t insert extra data. I need to save extra data in origin format to a special column (String-type) for further processing.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Some additional option for format, in which I can pass a column name. In that column Clickhouse will save unknown/skipped fields in origin format.

For example,

```INSERT INTO UserActivity FORMAT JSONEachRow(`skipped`) {"PageViews":5, "UserID":"4324182021466249494", "Duration":146,"Sign":-1,"SomeUnknownField":"StringValue"} {"UserID":"4324182021466249494","PageViews":6,"Duration":185,"Sign":1,"SomeOtherUnknownField":123}```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Insert all JSON object to one String column with short TTL for latter processing. Unfortunately Clickhouse doesn`t have any functions to modify JSONs (to cut some fields, for example).

When I am trying to run this query: 

```sql
SELECT * FROM products_d AS products GLOBAL ALL LEFT JOIN categories_d USING (categoryId);
```
The clickhouse throws an exception:
`[2020-06-18 17:20:01] Code: 47, e.displayText() = DB::Exception: Missing columns: 'categories_d.dateTime' 'categories_d.errorCode' 'categories_d.processingTimestampNs' 'categoryName' 'productIds' while processing query: 'SELECT dateTime, categoryId, productId, name, errorCode, processingTimestampNs, productIds, categoryName, categories_d.dateTime, categories_d.errorCode, categories_d.processingTimestampNs FROM products_d AS products GLOBAL ALL LEFT JOIN categories_d AS categories_d USING (categoryId)', required columns: 'dateTime' 'errorCode' 'categoryId' 'productId' 'productIds' 'name' 'categoryName' 'categories_d.processingTimestampNs' 'processingTimestampNs' 'categories_d.errorCode' 'categories_d.dateTime', source columns: 'processingTimestampNs' 'name' 'productId' 'categoryId' 'errorCode' 'dateTime', joined columns: (version 20.4.5.36 (official build))`

Here are the queries that create 2 tables:

```sql

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS products_data_hist (
   dateTime                  DateTime('UTC'),
   categoryId                LowCardinality(String),
   productId                 UUID,
   name                      LowCardinality(String),
   errorCode                 UInt8,
   processingTimestampNs     UInt64
) ENGINE = ReplicatedReplacingMergeTree('/clickhouse/tables/{shard}/%%DATABASE%%/products_data_hist', '{replica}', processingTimestampNs)
  PARTITION BY toYYYYMM(dateTime)
  ORDER BY (cityHash64(name), toDate(dateTime), productId)
  PRIMARY KEY (cityHash64(name), toDate(dateTime));

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS products_data_d_hist AS products_data_hist ENGINE = Distributed('kafka-cluster', %%DATABASE%%, products_data_hist, sipHash64(toString(productId)));

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS products_data_d_daily AS products_data_hist ENGINE = Distributed('kafka-cluster', %%DATABASE%%, products_data_hist, sipHash64(toString(productId)));

CREATE TABLE products_d as products_data_d_hist ENGINE=Merge('%%DATABASE%%', '^products_data_d_');
```

```sql

CREATE TABLE if NOT EXISTS categories_data_hist (
    productIds              Array(String),
    categoryId              UUID,
    categoryName            String,
    dateTime                DateTime('UTC'),
    errorCode               UInt8,
    processingTimestampNs   UInt64
) ENGINE ReplicatedReplacingMergeTree('/clickhouse/tables/{shard}/%%DATABASE%%/categories_data_hist', '{replica}', processingTimestampNs)
PARTITION BY toYYYYMM(dateTime)
ORDER BY (cityHash64(categoryName), toDate(dateTime))
```

title: GROUP BY capable of aggregating a single row to multiple groups
body:
Originally asked in
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61911990/way-to-achieve-overlapping-group-by-groups-with-correct-subtotals-in-clickhouse/

**Use case**

Example use cases:
- given a table containing answers to a survey with single- and multiple choice question (eg "which colors do you like? red/green/blue", "which devices do you own? pc/phone/tablet") stored as `Array(UInt8)` or `Array(String)` column per question, make a query resulting in a single table answering "how many users like red/gree/blue"?
- given a similar table, make a more complex query (partially user-defined via some interface) answering questions like "how many users like red and own a pc, compared to users who like blue and own a tablet or phone?" or "how many users were born between 1970 and 1990, compared to 1980 and 2000?"

Note that in all these cases, the groups are overlapping - a single user may need to be aggregated into multiple groups.

Additionally: these queries might use `ROLLUP` or `CUBE` and use more grouping levels (group by date, country, gender... maybe by 2-3 user-defined grouping sets at once)

**Solutions I tried**
All my current solutions are based on `arrayJoin`, for example:
for use case 1:
```
select
	date,
	arrayJoin(liked_color) as color,
	uniqExact(user) as num_users,
	sum(other_metrics) as other_metrics
from survey
group by date, color;
```

for use case 2:
```
select
	date,
	arrayJoin(arrayConcat(
		if(has(liked_color, 'red') and has(devices, 'pc'), [1], []),
		if(has(liked_color, 'blue') and (has(devices, 'tablet') or has(devices, 'phone')), [2], []),
		if(born between '1970-01-01' and '1990-01-01', [3], []),
		if(born between '1980-01-01' and '2000-01-01', [4], [])
	)) as custom_group,

	uniqExact(user) as num_users,
	sum(other_metrics) as other_metrics
from survey
group by date, custom_group;
```

They _do_ work for simple cases, but have two big issues:
- `arrayJoin` seems quite slow in general
- as soon as you use `ROLLUP`, `CUBE` or `WITH TOTALS`, the partial aggregations completely "break" - since `arrayJoin` "duplicates" rows, the same row will get added into the totals several times and `other_metrics` will be too big. This is not a bug - it's technically what I asked for in SQL, but not at all what I actually want. This forces me to either make separate queries for partial sums, or add extra bookkeeping into queries to only add each "duplicated row" into totals once - which slows down the query even more.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Something that aggregates by each _element_ of the array. In other words, semantically similar to `arrayJoin` + `group by`, except when combined with `rollup` or `totals` the row would still count only once.
In SQL syntax, maybe something like `group by date, UNPACK liked_color` or new variant of `arrayJoin`?

title: Optimize boolean conditions using CNF / DNF

labels.name: comp-optimizers
labels.description: Query optimizations

body:
### The problem

The table a more than hundred cols but only 3 of them are indexed, let call them `PARTITION A ORDER BY B, C, D`

The query use `A` `B` and `D` and another cols which is not indexed `E`.
And it's look like
```sql
select * from T where
A = x and (
    (B = 1 and D = 2 and E = 3) or
    (B = 1 and D = 3 and E = 4) /* .... repeated a lot of times */
)
```
While the numbers of condition is slow the query is quite fast (150ms), with 50 conditions the query start to take 10s and more.

Strangely if the wheres are re ordered like so :

```sql
select * from T where
A = x and (
    B = 1 and (
       D = 2 and (E = 3 or E=4 or E=5 /*.... repeated a lot of times */ ) OR
       D = 3 and (E = 3 or E=4 or E=5 /*.... repeated a lot of times */  ) OR
       /*.... repeated a lot of times */
   )
)
```

the query is sub seconds.
From the boolean point of view the filter is the same but it seems clickhouse like that a way more than the first one.

### Proposed solution 

Introduce optimizer(s) to convert logical expression to [conjunctive normal form](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunctive_normal_form) (CNF) or [disjunctive normal form](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disjunctive_normal_form) (DNF)

CNF is smth like
```
(c1 = 2 OR c1 = 5) AND (c2 < 5 OR c2 > 20) AND (c3 = 'abc' OR c3 = 'efg')
```

DNF is  smth like 
```
(c1 = 2 AND c2 = 5) OR (c2 > 5 AND c2 < 10) OR c3 = 'abc'
```

Any logical expression has CNF / DNF form. 

In some cases, CNF or DNF may be more preferable and both have more chances to use index than non-normalized conditions.

### Extra options

During those optimizations, it's may be possible to detect always true / always false sub-conditions and remove them.

### Some references in context of DBs
* https://docs.actian.com/psql/psqlv13/index.html#page/sqlref%2Fsqlperf.htm%23
* https://docs.teradata.com/reader/i_VlYHwN0b8knh6AEWrv1Q/o6Bog0jlIbA13_g1yNycTA
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Normal_forms_(logic)

labels.name: st-need-info
labels.description: We need extra data to continue

labels.name: v20.3-affected
labels.description: This issue affects some releases of v20.3

body:
**Describe the bug**
After executing the following command:
```
ALTER TABLE table DELETE WHERE pageviews < '2020-06-17'
```
The query executes and running `SELECT COUNT(*) FROM pageviews` runs correctly; however, running the following query on the table throws an error:
```
SELECT DISTINCT topic_id, uniqExact(content_id) content_count FROM pageviews WHERE user_id = 1 GROUP BY topic_id
```

The error is as follows:
```
Code: 246, e.displayText() = DB::Exception: Bad size of marks file '/var/lib/clickhouse/data/default/pageviews/20191222_0_21_2_46/content_id.null.mrk2': 0, must be: 4440: While executing MergeTreeThread (version 20.3.5.21 (official build))
```

**How to reproduce**
* ClickHouse 20.3.5.21 via Docker in Kubernetes
* Any interface
* Table is a ReplicatedMergeTree

From what I've noticed, the issue happens with any ReplicatedMergeTree regardless of schema. The delete operation involved deleting approximately 170 million rows.

I can't see any errors in the server logs for the actual delete command, so it just seems like the files in question aren't updated as intended?

title: Improve performance of FINAL modifier for Collapsing/Replacing MergeTree
body:
**Use case**
Clickhouse is a very good DB for load-and-analyze type of pattern, but its lack of primary key enforcement constraints limits it for typical monitoring case, when there is a need to query both most-recent (live) and historical data at the same time.
Some implementation is available with Replacing MergeTree allowing to collapse rows with same keys, however there is no 100% assureness on avoiding duplicates when data is flowing live, except using FINAL clause. 
Other descriptions of use case are in #8223,  #5125.  
Parallel FINAL #10463 is not really the solution here, since data may be queried from 3 month ago to today spanning across billions of rows. 


**Describe the solution you'd like**
1. Allow to specify parameter to not-do merge across partitions (merge-tree setting or system setting). This will let CH to assume that each partition already owns unique set of PKs. 
1. Skip merging of partitions when FINAL is specified IF (there is only one active part left in partition AND part.level>0 (has been merged at least once))

This will guarantee that previous days/hours/weeks/month data that has been optimized and merged to single part (by OPTIMIZE FINAL for partition that could be managed by ETL/externally by whatever is loading the data) won't require additional merges, and merge will only be done on most recent partition for which the data is being loaded. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There are many alternatives in other issues #8223,  #5125, but they don't seem to be feasible for analytics DB. 
There is no real way to do it relatively easier in application.

title: Add custom "-Map" aggregate function combinator
body:
**Use case**
Currently, there are sumMap/minMap/maxMap aggregate function combinator that allows calculating aggregated values in bins. 
It's quite a frequent use case considering lack of window functions. Examples include:
- Multiple random attributes are stored in row with id/values (and attributes may not match across rows), when custom aggregate function across attributes is needed with some precondition (e.g. median, quantile, etc.). Currently, the only way to achieve is to do fold/unfold with 2 level subqueries or double pass over an array with further arrayReduce. https://t.me/clickhouse_ru/148608
- Reducing two arrays for by keys as in `arrayReduce('medianMap', arr1, arr2);` (basically in-row custom  function), allowing making different aggregations with one fold/unfold loop. 
- Getting top-X% queries (e.g. top 10 percentile, or top-10) by multiple dimensions, now requires running separate subqueries with array group to calculate threshold value. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Having -Map generic aggregate function combinator would allow much simpler understanding and creating of multi-dimensional aggregates. 
Alternative could be defining arrayReduceByKeys function that would take two input arrays and bin them by keys array with custom aggregation function as discussed in https://t.me/clickhouse_ru/148584. 

**Additional context**
#4933 may address this request partially, or vice versa. -Map combinator would be more concise syntax (given already existing functions)
https://t.me/clickhouse_ru/148608

title: toDateTime64 shall not require timezone as mandatory input

labels.name: comp-datetime
labels.description: date & time & timezone related

body:
**Describe the unexpected behaviour**
toDateTime64 shall not require timezone as mandatory input. 

**How to reproduce**
```
SELECT toDateTime64(today(), 3, 'Europe/Moscow')

┌─toDateTime64(today(), 3, 'Europe/Moscow')─┐
│                   2020-06-17 00:00:00.000 │
└───────────────────────────────────────────┘

1 rows in set. Elapsed: 0.057 sec.


SELECT toDateTime64(today(), 3)

Received exception from server (version 20.3.8):
Code: 44. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Illegal column Const(UInt8) of time zone argument of function, must be constant string.

0 rows in set. Elapsed: 0.002 sec.

```


**Expected behavior**
toDateTime64() shall work with 2 input arguments, timezone shall be optional argument.
